quotes.quote: Don’t anthropomorphize computers – they hate it.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: Theory is when you know something, but it doesn’t work. Practice is when something works, but you don’t know why. Programmers combine theory and practice: Nothing works and they don’t know why.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kick boxing.
quotes.author: Emo Philips

quotes.quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quotes.quote: Physics is the universe’s operating system.
quotes.author: Steven R Garman

quotes.quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: The more you know, the more you realize you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Tell me and I forget.  Teach me and I remember.  Involve me and I learn.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: If people never did silly things, nothing intelligent would ever get done.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one’s ignorance.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.quote: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.quote: The most likely way for the world to be destroyed, most experts agree, is by accident.  That’s where we come in; we’re computer professionals.  We cause accidents.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Borenstein

quotes.quote: Pessimists, we’re told, look at a glass containing 50% air and 50% water and see it as half empty.  Optimists, in contrast, see it as half full.  Engineers, of course, understand the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.
quotes.author: Bob Lewis

quotes.quote: Mostly, when you see programmers, they aren’t doing anything.  One of the attractive things about programmers is that you cannot tell whether or not they are working simply by looking at them.  Very often they’re sitting there seemingly drinking coffee and gossiping, or just staring into space.  What the programmer is trying to do is get a handle on all the individual and unrelated ideas that are scampering around in his head.
quotes.author: Charles M. Strauss

quotes.quote: If you think you are worth what you know, you are very wrong.  Your knowledge today does not have much value beyond a couple of years.  Your value is what you can learn and how easily you can adapt to the changes this profession brings so often.
quotes.author: Jose M. Aguilar

quotes.quote: Commenting your code is like cleaning your bathroom — you never want to do it, but it really does create a more pleasant experience for you and your guests.
quotes.author: Ryan Campbell

quotes.quote: Low-level programming is good for the programmer’s soul.
quotes.author: John Carmack

quotes.quote: If you automate a mess, you get an automated mess.
quotes.author: Rod Michael

quotes.quote: Looking at code you wrote more than two weeks ago is like looking at code you are seeing for the first time.
quotes.author: Dan Hurvitz

quotes.quote: Less than 10% of the code has to do with the ostensible purpose of the system; the rest deals with input-output, data validation, data structure maintenance, and other housekeeping.
quotes.author: Mary Shaw

quotes.quote: Programming without an overall architecture or design in mind is like exploring a cave with only a flashlight: You don’t know where you’ve been, you don’t know where you’re going, and you don’t know quite where you are.
quotes.author: Danny Thorpe

quotes.quote: A change in perspective is worth 80 IQ points.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.quote: The future is not laid out on a track. It is something that we can decide, and to the extent that we do not violate any known laws of the universe, we can probably make it work the way that we want to.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.quote: Make everything as simple as possible, but not simpler.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Today, most software exists, not to solve a problem, but to interface with other software.
quotes.author: IO Angell

quotes.quote: Program testing can be a very effective way to show the presence of bugs, but is hopelessly inadequate for showing their absence.
quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra

quotes.quote: UNIX is simple.  It just takes a genius to understand its simplicity.
quotes.author: Dennis Ritchie

quotes.quote: Being able to break security doesn’t make you a hacker anymore than being able to hotwire cars makes you an automotive engineer.
quotes.author: Eric Raymond

quotes.quote: If you think technology can solve your security problems, then you don’t understand the problems and you don’t understand the technology.
quotes.author: Bruce Schneier

quotes.quote: Companies spend millions of dollars on firewalls, encryption and secure access devices, and it’s money wasted, because none of these measures address the weakest link in the security chain.
quotes.author: Kevin Mitnick

quotes.quote: In an information economy, the most valuable company assets drive themselves home every night. If they are not treated well, they do not return the next morning.
quotes.author: Peter Chang

quotes.quote: Most creativity is a transition from one context into another where things are more surprising. Our job is to remind us that there are more contexts than the one that we’re in — the one that we think is reality.
quotes.author: Alan Kay
